messages.text:
Hello nigeltao (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change.

i'm not really expecting you to accept this patch, to be honest,
but it illustrates one possibility for the calling convention.

i think i'm of the general opinion that the clipping functionality
belongs elsewhere. it's not hard to define a draw.Image that
layers onto another draw.Image and clips anything drawn through it.
i think that might be a better approach.

On 23 September 2010 15:16,  <rogpeppe@gmail.com> wrote:
> Reviewers: nigeltao,
>
> Message:
> Hello nigeltao (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
>
> I'd like you to review this change.
>
>
> Description:
> freetype: change DrawString calling conventions.
>
> Please review this at http://codereview.appspot.com/2237046/
>
> Affected files:
>  M example/freetype/main.go
>  M freetype/freetype.go
>
>
>
i might be talked into this

subject: code review 2237046: freetype: change DrawString calling conventions.
